poem:
Economics In Decline

Devices of greed,
figures dance in the margins.
A sledgehammer tax  
raises its metallic head  
while the gas runs cold  
in fine-strewn homes.  
An insatiable hunger  
gnaws at the heart,  
a monetary symphony  
echoes in corridors  
where souls are sold  
under the Bank's  
myopic gaze.
